com.meteorcode.pathway.script

Class ScriptContainer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.meteorcode.pathway.script.ScriptContainer

  • public abstract class ScriptContainer
extends java.lang.Object
    A fully formed evaluator for a scripting language, complete with environment and evaluator. For all intents and purposes, this is the "top level" of a script's scope; things evaluated inside a Container evaluate at the **GLOBAL** level inside this container. That can be good and it can be bad. Either way, that's how this design is. In order to separate scripts' scopes, it should be necessary to create multiple script containers.

      Init the script container with the default script environment.

      Init an new ScriptContainer and link in a ScriptEnvironment.

      • ScriptContainer

        public ScriptContainer(ScriptEnvironment environment)

    • Method Detail

      • eval

        public abstract java.lang.Object eval(FileHandle file)
                               throws ScriptException,
                                      java.io.IOException
        Evaluates a script stored in a file.

        If there is no return, you get back null instead of an object.

        If an exception is thrown from the scripts, it is re-wrapped as a generic ScriptException, with the exception's cause being the actual exception thrown by the script.

        Parameters:
        file - a FileHandle containing the script to execute.
        Returns:
        The object result of the evaluation, or null if there was no result.
        Throws:
        ScriptException - if an error takes place during script execution.
        java.io.IOException - if an error takes place while accessing the script's file.

      • eval

        public abstract java.lang.Object eval(java.lang.String script)
                               throws ScriptException
        Evaluates a literal expression or multiple expressions and returns the possible result.

        If there is no return, you get back null instead of an object.

        If an exception is thrown from the scripts, it is re-wrapped as a generic ScriptException, with the exception's cause being the actual exception thrown by the script.

        Parameters:
        script - The string of literal text to interpret as a script.
        Returns:
        The object result of the evaluation, or null if there was no result.
        Throws:
        ScriptException - if an error takes place during script execution.

      • injectObject

        public abstract void injectObject(java.lang.String scriptName,
                java.lang.Object object)
                           throws ScriptException
        Put data into the scripting environment globally.
        Parameters:
        scriptName - The name of the variable exposed to scripts
        object - The object to bind to this variable name
        Throws:
        ScriptException - if the injection attempt fails.

      • removeObject

        public abstract void removeObject(java.lang.String scriptName)
                           throws ScriptException
        Removes an object from the scripting environment.

        The variable name of the unbound object will now test `[name] == void`.

        Parameters:
        scriptName - the name of the variable to unbind
        Throws:
        ScriptException

      • access

        public abstract java.lang.Object access(java.lang.String variable)
                                 throws ScriptException,
                                        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

        Accesses the contents of a variable in the script environment.

        Parameters:
        variable - the name of the script variable to access
        Returns:
        the contents of the variable if it exists, null if the variable does not exist.
        Throws:
        ScriptException - if the script container cannot access the variable
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the variable name to access is an invalid token or an expression.
